title: How to Use The Roost Café in Animal Crossing: New Leaf

steps.headline: Construct the Museum Shop first.
steps.description: Know that there are also requirements for constructing the Museum Shop. You have to have been the mayor of the town for at least a week. You must have donated at least 20 items to the Museum, including at least one item in each category (bugs, fish/deep sea creatures, fossils, and art works).

steps.headline: Enter the museum to find Blathers thinking about something.
steps.description: Talk to him and he will tell you about his idea for a Museum Shop.

steps.headline: Sit down in your mayor chair and go to the public works projects.
steps.description: You will find the Museum Shop on the list, so choose it. You cannot suggest a public work project if there is one needing donations already outstanding. Pay off all the money for any public work projects you still need to complete first.

steps.headline: Go to the Train Station and find Lloid.
steps.description: Pay him 198,000 bells and the next day you will have the Museum Shop.

steps.headline: Work on the requirements for building the Roost Café next.
steps.description: You must have donated at least 50 items to the Museum. It must be seven days after the Museum Shop has been open.

steps.headline: Talk to Blathers and he will ask you to build the Roost Café.
Sit down in your mayor chair and go to public works projects.
steps.description: You will find the Roost Café on the list, so choose it. Then find a place in your town where you would like to build it.

steps.headline: Pay 298,000 bells to Lloid, and the next day you will have the Roost Café.

parts.name: Getting a Job at the Cafe

steps.headline: Have seven cups of coffee at the Roost Café.
steps.description: You may purchase one cup per day, for 200 bells.

steps.headline: Talk to Brewster on the right-hand side of the bar.
steps.description:
He will ask if you would like a part-time job. You can only work between 11:00 a.m. and 11:00 p.m.
You can't work on holidays.

steps.headline: Serve villagers coffee.
steps.description: Three villagers (not always from your town) and one special character will come and ask for coffee. Each villager has their own favorite coffee bean type, sugar amount, and milk quantity. The options for bean type are mocha, blend, blue mountain and kilimanjaro. The options for sugar amounts are none, one spoonful, two spoonfuls and three spoonfuls. The options for milk quantities are none, a little, the regular amount and lots. Remember their favorite combinations because they will usually only tell you once, and you will get paid better for giving them their favorite combination. Create a table if it helps. That way you can see what beans and amounts each character prefers so you can get it right if they return.

steps.headline: Complete the shift.
steps.description: After every shift, the number of favorite combinations you make will determine the type of coffee beans Brewster will give you as payment. If you get 1-4 combinations right, then Brewster will give you normal coffee beans. They are worth 500 bells at Re-Tail. If you get 5-8 combinations right, then Brewster will give you good coffee beans. They are worth 1,000 bells at Re-Tail. If you get 9-12 combinations right, then Brewster will give you superb coffee beans. They are worth 2,000 bells at Re-Tail.

steps.headline: Get café themed furniture.
steps.description:
Over time, if the player does well as a barista, Brewster may reward them with different furniture, such as coffee cups and coffee makers. Brewster will also give uniforms and Brewster themed gyroids. The items he will give you are:
Cream and sugar
Coffee cup
Coffee grinder
Coffeemaker
Espresso maker
Siphon
Brewstoid (tall, mega regular and mini)
Cafe uniform
